cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 535 miles ESE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest through the Bahamas, expected to turn northwest near Cuba and track toward the Florida Keys/south Florida, then move north-northwest inland into Georgia and the southeastern United States.

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Jupiter Inlet to Sebastian Inlet and north of Bonita Beach to Venice, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including the Florida Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast U.S. coastline from the Florida Keys northward to Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (over 50%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds with the possibility of brief hurricane-force gusts as Irma's core moves inland Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 3–6 ft storm-surge inundation along the Georgia coast, especially if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rain with isolated amounts up to 10 inches could produce flash flooding in coastal Georgia.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning this weekend; isolated tornadoes possible in outer rainbands.
